intro: Persicaria tenella var. kawagoeana, commonly known as Kawagoe's knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. Its small, pinkish-white flowers bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
